article_title: Small US towns see higher rates of youth suicide
article_text: Volunteers in Wyoming are trying to promote change from the bottom up, training citizens to talk to someone who may be in danger of hurting themselves. The program has been adopted by some of the state's largest employers, community organizations and churches, said Terresa Humphries-Wadsworth, a psychologist in Cody who is the statewide director of suicide prevention for the nonprofit Prevention Management Organization of Wyoming.

article_metadata.description: Rural adolescents commit suicide at roughly twice the rate of their urban peers, according to a study published in the May issue of the journal JAMA Pediatrics.

og.description: Rural adolescents commit suicide at roughly twice the rate of their urban peers, according to a study published in the May issue of the journal JAMA Pediatrics.

The program has been adopted by some of the state's largest employers, community organizations and churches, said Terresa Humphries-Wadsworth, a psychologist in Cody who is the statewide director of suicide prevention for the nonprofit Prevention Management Organization of Wyoming.
